result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Harry Richard Gilbertson

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt:
Calling cases 22CF345 and 22TR2842

9:18 AM Defendant Harry Richard Gilbertson in court.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for Harry Richard Gilbertson.  Attorney Mark Adam Fruehauf in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney-Client waives preliminary hearing. Court finds waiver knowing/voluntary; finds probable cause that a felony was committed and binds over for arraignment. Court reminds of bail/conditions. Trailing traffic set for STC
Arraignment scheduled for December 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription. No operation of a motor vehicle unless Defendant has valid permit or license.

1:28 PM Defendant Harry Richard Gilbertson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Ryan Anthony Reid appeared by video for Harry Richard Gilbertson.  Prosecuting attorney Allison E. Cogbill in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant's address confirmed. Attorney/Defendant acknowledges receipt of the complaint, waives a formal reading, enters pleas of not guilty to the misdemeanor count(s), and requests a preliminary hearing. State asks for $3000 cash. No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription. No operation of a motor vehicle unless Defendant has valid permit or license. State reviews the pending allegations and reviews previous WI convictions, one from a case being settled last week. State reviews defendant's FTAs in previous files and notes 38 prior convictions in MN. Notes convictions for escape from custody and giving false name to police. Attorney Reid notes that the defendant's address is in Douglas County. Defendant is currently unemployed. Acknowledges prior criminal history and asks for $1000 cash bond. Defendant and Attorney ask for breakout room.
1:45 PM Court recalls case. Attorney Reid now requests to $600 cash bond. Defendant also wanted Court to be aware of some health issues. Court notes concerns over FTAs and previous convictions.
Court orders $1500 cash. No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription. No operation of a motor vehicle unless Defendant has valid permit or license.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 09:15 am.
